page.title: 08CLUTTON'S RAILWAY
page.content: The last train that came to Clutton was 17 years ago. The line was part of the Great Western Railway.A few children used it to go to schools in Bristol. Once a year there was a day excursion to Barry Island. The station seemed old fashioned. There were two platforms which were quite small.There was a tiny ticket office,toilets and a signal box along the line. In the waiting room was a small coal fire. People miss the railway even now because it was so easy to travel everywhere on it. {BROMILOW'S YARD The disused station is now Bromilow's coal and lorry yard. The company provides a transport service carrying containers all over the world.Amongst the lorries is the Clutton carnival float used every year. {
